transcripts.text: Hey hey hey!  Welcome back to a new video.  This week I decided to take a look at some of the video requests you guys sent me, and I found a video about chemtrails.  Dun dun dun! Alexa, what is a chemtrail?  Chemtrail.  Trails left by aircraft are actually chemical or biological agents deliberately sprayed at high altitudes for a purpose undisclosed to the general public in clandestine programs directed by government officials.

There's no way in hell.  Alexis actually says that, right?  I don't have one of those myself, so I can't confirm.  Can someone in the comment section tell me if that's actually what it says?  when you ask, what is a chemtrail?  Please, I'm dying to know.

You know, I've already done many videos on chemtrails and geoengineering aerosol spraying.  And this video is not going to be a detailed, scientific, boring fact sheet.  No, it's going to be a little more of a rant because I am so tired of people who are brain dead.

Really?  It's not like you can make this scientific even if you tried, right?  I mean, no offense personally to you or anything, I don't even know you, but there really isn't any scientific material that supports the existence of chemicals being sprayed into the air by the government for some purpose undisclosed to the public.  That just doesn't exist.  The closest thing there is to an actual chemtrail are small planes that fly over crop fields and spray pesticides over them.  Those are limited to the local area and the reason is fully disclosed to everyone.  You can't really scientifically argue for the chemtrails you're talking about though.

Listen to me and read my lips.  Chemtrails are not contrails.  Contrails are trails of condensation that you can see sometimes when a jet is traveling above 30,000 feet, but they disappear in a very short time.

That's actually not true.  The time that contrails last in the sky varies depending on many factors.  Higher altitudes and cooler temperatures, for example, can serve to keep the water vapor condensed for longer periods of time.  But in general, these contrails are usually visible for a while due to the aerosols being released from the plane's engines.  And don't freak out because I used the word aerosol, by the way.  There's only a minimal amount being released and it's a harmless solid material such as dust.  These aerosols give a form of grip for the water molecules to grasp onto and condense into clouds.  Yes, that's right.  Contrails are essentially just clouds.  And because of the stability of the water molecules and the aerosol grip, contrails can be visible in the sky for a long time.  That's the images you see when people are crying chemtrails.  They're just contrails.  End of story.
Chemtrails are completely different and sprayed from jets at a lower altitude and they always persist in the sky.  Sometimes you can see them falling.

Quite a wild claim you made there.  Could you perhaps back up your hypothesis?  How do you know that these are chemtrails instead of just contrails?  What evidence do you have that says these aren't just contrails that lasted for a longer period of time?  Have you gotten a sample and tested what were in those trails?  Where are your claims coming from?

pilots admitting that they do it, I don't know where that footage is from, but that is most definitely a troll.  You can tell from the tone of their voices that they're obviously joking. and even the former director of the CIA, John Brennan, speaking about it at a Council on Foreign Relations meeting.

Another example is the array of technologies, often referred to collectively as geoengineering, that potentially could help reverse the warming effects of global climate change.  One that has gained my personal attention is stratospheric aerosol injection, or SAI, a method of seeding the stratosphere with particles that can help reflect the sun's heat in much the same way that volcanic eruptions do.

You know, atmospheric aerosol injections is actually a completely different topic, but conspiracy theorists love to lace it together with their chemtrail hypothesis.  Aerosol injections is part of a type of a large group of sunlight manipulation called solar radiation management, or SRMs.  What are SRMs?  Well, as you know, the planet is warming, human activities are warming the climate, which will lead to detrimental effects, especially in the future.  A solution that has been explored extensively are SRMs, which includes a variety of methods to reflect sunlight back into space.  Reducing the incoming sunlight will reduce temperatures, which could work to slow down the effects of global warming.  One proposed method of SRMs are atmospheric injections of aerosols.  Now let me explain briefly how it works.  Clouds in the sky have a high albedo property, meaning they reflect sunlight.  So in this sense, we can increase the quantity of clouds in the atmosphere to do just that.  An easy way to stimulate the formation of clouds is to introduce aerosols in the air.  Like I mentioned previously, water vapor can grip around the aerosols and condense it to clouds.  So by injecting more aerosols into the sky, more clouds can form.  I believe the most popular proposed aerosol to use right now is salt.  We can just take salt water from the oceans and put them to good use.  Doesn't sound too bad, right?  This is a topic that is quite irrelevant to chemtrails, but since you don't understand the science of it or why it is being done, I can understand how you could confuse SRMs with the spraying of non-existent chemicals.

Hmm, I wonder why.

Four million.  610,000 parts per million of aluminum.

Why don't you think about that for a bit and get back to me when you realize why that's impossible.
